sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'; const CookiePolicy = () => (
{/* Icon and Title */}

Cookie Policy for Avyakta

Last updated: [Insert Date]
  • 🔹 What Are Cookies?
    Cookies are small text files stored on your device when you visit a website. They help us improve user experience, enhance security, and remember your preferences.
  • 🔹 How We Use Cookies
    At Avyakta, we use minimal and essential cookies only. Our cookies:
    • 🛡️ Ensure website security and protection
    • 🚀 Improve site speed and performance
    • 🌐 Remember your language or accessibility preferences
    • 🧠 Help prevent spam or misuse through tools like reCAPTCHA
    • 🔄 Track anonymous analytics data (non-personal) for service improvement
  • 🔹 We Do NOT Use:
    • ❌ Advertising cookies
    • ❌ Third-party marketing trackers
    • ❌ Any cookies that compromise your privacy
  • 🔹 Types of Cookies We Use
    Type Purpose
    Strictly Necessary Enable core site functionality and form submissions
    Functional Remember preferences like dark/light mode or language toggle
    Security Prevent bots, spam, and unauthorized activity
    Analytics (optional) To understand how users interact with the platform (fully anonymous)
  • 🔹 Your Choices
    You are in control. You can:
    • ✅ Accept all cookies
    • ⚙️ Adjust browser settings to block or delete cookies
    • 🔒 Continue using the website without sharing personal info
    Note: Some essential features may not function properly if cookies are disabled.
  • 🔹 Third-Party Tools Used
    • Google reCAPTCHA (to prevent spam)
    • MongoDB Atlas (secured backend, doesn't use cookies)
    • Optional tools like Google Analytics (only if you enable it)
  • 🔹 Changes to This Policy
    We may update this Cookie Policy to reflect changes in legal or technical requirements. Updates will be posted here with the date.
  • 🔹 Need Help?
    If you have questions or concerns about our Cookie Policy, please contact:
    support@avyakta.org
); export default CookiePolicy;
